articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Party Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Chinese Party Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly talk with the friendship delegation of the Communist Party of China led by Luo Shugang, permanent deputy head of the Publicity Department of its Central Committee, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.
					On the occasion the head of the delegation noted that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship was provided by the elder revolutionaries and that the two parties and countries have supported and cooperated with each other for many years.
					
					It is the steadfast stand of the Chinese party and government to consolidate and develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries, he said, expressing belief that the bilateral friendship would continue to be strengthened under the deep care of General Secretary Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would achieve signal successes in the efforts to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation by displaying the spirit of self-reliance and fortitude under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Party Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Party Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting friendship delegation of the Communist Party of China.
					 The gift was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, on Thursday by Luo Shugang, permanent deputy head of the Publicity Department of the C.C., Communist Party of China who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: Congratulations to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Congratulations to President of Guinea-Bissau
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Malam  Bacai  Sanha upon his election as President of Guinea-Bissau.
					 Kim in the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future and sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work for the national reconciliation and unity and the socio-economic development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Jamaican Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Jamaican Prime Minister
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Thursday sent a message of greetings to Bruce Golding, Prime Minister of Jamaica, on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of independence of Jamaica.
					 The message wished the friendly Jamaican people prosperity and welfare.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves to Visit Asian Countries
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves to Visit Asian Countries
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry headed by Vice-Minister Kim Yong Il left here by air on Thursday to visit Asian countries.

articles.title: Calligraphic Exhibition Opens
articles.content:
Calligraphic Exhibition Opens
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- A calligraphic exhibition was opened with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International Cultural Center Thursday to mark the 50th anniversary of the Formation of the Union of Korean Writers and Artists in Japan.
					 Displayed in the venue of the exhibition are more than 60 calligraphic works presented by calligraphers and calligraphy lovers of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					
					Calligraphic works including letters and excellent sentences profound in contents and strong in appeal written in various styles including Chongbong style and lyric verses and others clearly show the progress made by Chongryon in calligraphy. 
					
					Among them are works including "My Country, My Homeland", "Single-Minded Unity", "Great Prosperous and Powerful Nation" and "A Fleet Steed" representing the warm love of the officials and compatriots of Chongryon for the socialist homeland demonstrating the dignity and might of the country and the nation by dint of Songun under the great leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					Also on display are works reflecting the faith and will of the Koreans in Japan to breathe the same breath with the people in the homeland on the road of patriotism and works calling upon all Koreans to turn out in a sacred struggle for reunification, united close under the banner of "By our nation itself." 
					
					Among those present at the ceremony were Han Chol, vice- minister of Culture, Kim Song Min, chairman of the Central Committee of the Artists Union of Korea, members of the delegation of the Union of Korean Writers and Artists in Japan headed by its Chairman Kim Jong Su, officials concerned, art creators, calligraphers and calligraphy lovers in Pyongyang and students of Pyongyang University of Fine Arts.
					
					Kim Jong Su in his opening address said that his union would creditably fulfill its mission and duty in the struggle to develop the movement of Koreans in Japan and the literature and art of Chongryon and produce more calligraphic works of great cognitive and educational value.

articles.title: Film Show Arranged for Diplomatic Corps Here
articles.content:
Film Show Arranged for Diplomatic Corps Here
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The diplomatic corps here watched Parts 2 and 3 of the Korean feature film "The Country I Saw" at Taedongmun Cinema on Thursday.
					 Paek Han Su, vice-chairman of the State Film Commission, and Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned watched the film together with them.
					
					 The film deeply impressed the audience as it makes a vivid artistic representation of the truth that the greatness of the country and the nation lies in that of its leader and the reality of the DPRK demonstrating its might thanks to its ever-victorious Songun politics.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Laos
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Laos 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Guard Command of the Lao Ministry of Security Defence.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned Thursday by Deputy Commander of the above-said guard command Bunphang Tilasak on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Delegation
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket by the visiting delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					 The basket was conveyed to an official concerned by Fujio Hanawa, secretary general of the National Liaison Council of the society who is leading the delegation, on Wednesday.

articles.title: Creation of Embroidery Original Picture by Computer
articles.content:
Creation of Embroidery Original Picture by Computer
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The embroidery original pictures are drawn by image processing program of computer in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					The creation of the embroidery original picture is done, divided into data collection, draft composition and simulation and drawing of original picture.
					
					At the stage of data collection, the data gathered on the spot by digital camera are inputted into computer.
					
					At the stage of draft composition and simulation, the picture composition and colors are simulated by compositing and cutting the already-covered data and adding picture to them.
					
					At the stage of drawing original picture, the size of picture is confirmed and the picture is drawn on the basis of the draft.
					
					The completed original picture is printed to be used in stitchwork.
					
					The creation of the embroidery original picture by computer makes it possible to ensure the speed and quality of the picture and thus to raise the economic effectiveness.

articles.title: New Weightlifting Star
articles.content:
New Weightlifting Star
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Kuk Hyang, aged 16 years, of the April 25 Sports Team of the DPRK, proved successful at the world juvenile weightlifting circles to be blessed by the people.
					She bagged three gold medals with her overwhelming capability in the women's above 69kg category competition at the 1st World Juvenile Weightlifting Championships held in Thailand.
					
					Those who participated in the open-category competition weighed over 110kg. But the weight of Kim Kuk Hyang was no more than 85kg. 
					
					She lifted 221kg total with 96kg in snatch and 125kg in jerk to garner three gold medals.
					
					She overpowered all the heavyweights who weighed 20kg more than her on an average, attracting the attention of the experts. It is rare to be seen.
					
					She was appreciated as the strongest among the more than 20 heavyweights in the championships.

articles.title: Kwijin Temple
articles.content:
Kwijin Temple
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kwijin Temple in Songwol-ri, Sohung County of North Hwanghae Province is one of the famous temples in Korea.
					It was built in the middle of the 12th century and rebuilt in the 16th century. Originally there were several buildings around the Kukrak Hall. But now remain the Kukrak Hall, Juak Pavilion and Simgom Hall.
					
					The gable-roofed Kukrak Hall was built with large structural parts as a whole. It has four pillars each in the front and in the flank. Its stone stylobate is nearly two meters high and has stone steps in the front.
					
					More than 2,000 wood blocks for printing Buddhist book were preserved in the Simgom Hall. They are known as the oldest ones out of the wood blocks that have been discovered.
					
					 The "Ryonggamsugyong" (Buddhist dictionary) published in 997 is a valuable datum in studying the history of printing technology development in Korea. Its wooden printing blocks were carried away by the Japanese imperialists in 1931 and some remainders are kept in the Myohyangsan History Museum.
					
					 The temple serves as a precious material to study the then architecture.

articles.title: "Pyongyang Speed" Created in Chollima Era
articles.content:
"Pyongyang Speed" Created in Chollima Era
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Today builders of the new generation in the DPRK are erecting modern dwelling houses and lots of monumental edifices one after another in different parts of the country with the spirit with which the constructors created the "Pyongyang speed" in the postwar period.
					In the period of the great Chollima upsurge, the builders turned out as one, upholding the far-sighted plan of construction mapped out by President Kim Il Sung to provide big dwellings to the Korean people who were living in shacks in the ground, having their houses destroyed in the three-year-long Korean war provoked by the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 But they were bare-handed.
					
					 If something, it was the will and conviction to build a rich and powerful country on the severe war-debris, holding aloft the intention of the President.
					
					 They wrought miracles and innovations day by day, nay hour by hour, with not only iron crane but also wooden one, pooling their wisdom.
					
					 In 1958 they created the "Pyongyang speed" by assembling a flat in 14 minutes and constructing in a year dwelling houses for more than 20,000 families which would take 3-4 years in ordinary times, with the materials, fund and manpower for 7,000.
					
					 The "Pyongyang speed" was renovated in the 1960s and the 1970s, creating miracles of assembling a flat in 11 minutes and then in 7 minutes.
					
					 In the speed new streets such as Chollima, Pipha and Rakwon streets were constructed one after another in Pyongyang.
					
					 The lofty spirit with which those in the Chollima era unconditionally carried out what the President wanted is being displayed to the full in every working site of the 150-day campaign today.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Remain True to Idea of "By Our Nation Itself"
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- "By our nation itself" clarified in the inter-Korean joint declarations is the transparent idea of national independence and the noble idea of national unity, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 "By our nation itself" is the idea enshrined in the minds of all the Koreans and the basic spirit of the June 15 era of reunification and the vitality of the spirit of "By our nation itself" has been fully demonstrated through the actual movement for national reunification.
					
					 To depend on the efforts of the Korean nation or rely on foreign forces is a touchstone to distinguish the patriotic stand from treachery, reunification from division and independence from subjugation.
					
					 The issue of Korea's reunification can be successfully settled only when the north and the south struggle in the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 Full play to the spirit of "By our nation itself" provides a sure guarantee for achieving national unity, independent reunification and prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 The independent and peaceful reunification of Korea would be unthinkable without concord between the north and the south and great national unity.
					
					 For all Koreans to firmly unite themselves means the reunification of the country.
					
					 Bright is the future of the Korean nation promoting the historic cause of national reunification by giving full play to the spirit of "By our nation itself", the idea of national independence and national unity.

articles.title: Puppet Authorities' Action to Abridge Freedom of Expression Flayed
articles.content:
Puppet Authorities' Action to Abridge Freedom of Expression Flayed
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and public organizations including the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society and the Solidarity of Persons of Culture and opposition parties of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on August 3 in protest against the unreasonable action taken by the group of traitors.
					Speakers at the press conference accused the authorities of working out "enforcement regulations on the use and management of plaza" which contain poisonous articles calling for checking meetings and demonstrations at Kwanghwamun plaza. 
					
					They assailed the authorities for their action to suppress the freedom of expression and violate even elementary human right and held that the unreasonable "enforcement regulations" aimed at depriving the civic and public organizations of their right to use Kwanghwamun should be repealed as early as possible. 
					
					They declared the organizations and the opposition parties would turn out in the struggle to convert the plaza into one for the people.
					
					In another development, the fascist police rushed to the venue of the conference even before its start and perpetrated such a tyrannical action as arresting 10 participants on charges of violation of "law on assembly and demonstration".
					
					 Members of the above-said organizations and opposition parties noted the police's tyrannical action heralds a repressive campaign to be kicked off over the issue of the use of Kwanghwamun plaza in the future.

articles.title: Stop to Use of Tear Liquid against Protesters Demanded
articles.content:
Stop to Use of Tear Liquid against Protesters Demanded 
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Joint Conference of Human Rights Organizations and other civic and public organizations of south Korea held a press conference on August 3 to demand the puppet police stop the use of tear liquid, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The organizations charged that the police sprayed tear liquid containing carcinogenic substance and poison fatal to human bodies upon unionists of Ssangyong Motor Co. from helicopters.
					
					The workers exposed to the tear liquid are suffering from all kinds of skin diseases and burn, they held, demanding the police immediately stop such atrocity.

articles.title: Day of Korean People's Victory in War Observed
articles.content:
Day of Korean People's Victory in War Observed
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on July 27 to mark the 56th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					The statement said that the Fatherland Liberation War conducted by the Korean people was a war of justice against the U.S. imperialists and for the national liberation and the class emancipation and it proved that the way for defeating imperialism is to fight with arms and nobody should have any slightest illusion about imperialism.
					
					 It stressed that the victory won by the DPRK in the war was attributable to the distinguished military stratagem and Juche-based tactics of President Kim Il Sung and the Korean people's heroic spirit of self-sacrifice.
					
					It expressed belief that if the U.S. imperialists recklessly provoke a war again in the Korean Peninsula, the Korean people led by General Secretary Kim Jong Il would surely beat them down and achieve the country's reunification.

articles.title: Three Charters for Korea's Reunification Favored in Egypt
articles.content:
Three Charters for Korea's Reunification Favored in Egypt
 Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The Egypt-Korea Friendship Association issued bulletin "Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower" on July 29.
					 The bulletin in an article noted that the tower was erected in 2001 marking the 56th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, advanced by President Kim Il Sung, as the three charters for Korea's reunification and set them forth as the important guideline to be adhered to by all Koreans desirous of national reunification, the bulletin said, adding:
					
					 The tower remains the strong pillar for reunification in the hearts of all Koreans, who have turned out in the struggle to add luster to the June 15 era of reunification under the banner of the north-south joint declaration.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Supported
Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- We were deeply impressed to witness the reality of the DPRK, in which all the people are united as one in mind around President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, when we visited it in the past period.
					 Seyed Hossein Mousabi Tabrizi, president of the Central Council of the Iran Parties House, said this on July 29 when the DPRK ambassador to his country paid a courtesy call on him.
					
					We are rejoiced over the fact that the Korean people are achieving proud successes in the 150-day campaign for building a great prosperous and powerful nation true to the Songun politics of
						Kim Jong Il, he said, adding:
					
					We are firmly convinced that the Korean people will surely emerge victorious in the efforts to open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012 commemorating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.
					
					We highly appreciate the fact that the Korean people successfully launched an artificial satellite and have maintained its determined stand in the nuclear issue despite pressures of the United States and the West.
					
					The Iranian people sincerely hope that the reunification of Korea would be realized by the Korean people themselves, free from the U.S. interference. 
					
					He expressed hope that support and cooperation between the Iran Parties House and the Workers' Party of Korea would continue to be strengthened in the international arena.

articles.title: Premier coreano felicita a su homologo  jamaicano
articles.content:
Premier coreano felicita a su homologo  jamaicano
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, envio el dia 6 un mensaje a su homologo jamaicano, Bruce Golding, para felicitarle por el 47o aniversario de la independencia de ese pais americano. 
					 El remitente deseo la prosperidad y bienestar al amistoso pueblo jamaicano.

articles.title: Cuerpo Diplomatico presencia filme "El pais que conoci"
articles.content:
Cuerpo Diplomatico presencia filme "El pais que conoci"
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Cuerpo Diplomatico acreditado en Corea presencio el dia 6 en el capitalino Cine Taedongmun la pelicula coreana "El pais que conoci" (segunda y tercera partes).
					Tambien la vieron el vicepresidente del Comite Estatal de Cine, Paek Han Su, el vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Paek Yong Ho,  y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					La pelicula dio la gran emocion a los espectadores demostrandoles vividamente la verdad de que la grandeza del pais y la nacion reside en la noble personalidad del gran dirigente y la realidad de Corea que exalta su poderio a todo el mundo gracias a la invencible politica de Songun (priorizacion militar).

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe regalo de delegacion china
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe regalo de delegacion china
Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presente que le dedicara la delegacion de amistad del Partido Comunista de China presidida por el subjefe permanente del departamento de propaganda del Comite Central, Luo Shugang, de visita en Corea.
					El jefe de la delegacion lo entrego el dia 6 al secretario del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Thae Bok.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun defiende el ideal de independencia y unidad
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun defiende el ideal de independencia y unidad
 Pyongyang, 6 de agosto (ATCC) -- El ideal de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales" estipulado en las declaraciones conjuntas Norte-Sur esta matizado por la fuerte independencia nacional y el noble llamado a la unidad nacional.
					 Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este jueves y continua:
					
					 Ese ideal pannacional, que acepta todos los coreanos con el corazon, es el espiritu fundamental de la epoca de reunificacion del 15 de Junio.
					
					Su vitalidad se ha manifestado plenamente en las practicas del movimiento por la reunificacion de la patria.
					
					 Resolver los asuntos nacionales entre los connacionales o mediante la dependencia de las fuerzas extranjeras es la pauta que determina el patriotismo o la traicion a la patria, la reunificacion o la division, y la independencia o la subyugacion.
					
					  Es posible resolver con exito el problema de la reunificacion del pais cuando el Norte y el Sur se basen en el ideal en cuestion.
					
					  La garantia principal de la unidad nacional, la reunificacion independiente y la prosperidad comun de la nacion esta en materializar plenamente el ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
					
					 Al margen de la armonia entre el Norte y el Sur y la gran unidad nacional, no se puede imaginar la reunificacion independiente y pacifica de la patria.
					
					Es que la reunificacion de la patria es precisamente la unidad solida de todos los connacionales.
					
					 Es maravilloso el futuro de la nacion coreana que va cumpliendo con adelanto esa historica causa nacional manifestando en alto grado el espiritu de "Entre nosotros, los connacionales".
